member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider
member.summary: Provides support for communication between UI Automation providers and UI Automation client applications.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.AppendRuntimeId
member.summary: Contains a value that, when returned as the first element of the array passed by the UI Automation provider to , indicates that the ID is partial and should be appended to the ID provided by the base provider.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.InvalidateLimit
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of events to send before batching.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.ItemsInvalidateLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of events to send before batching for items in containers.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.RootObjectId
member.summary: Contains a value used in the member of a message, indicating that the server should return a reference to the root raw element provider.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.HostProviderFromHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns a UI Automation provider that represents the specified window.
member.param: The handle of the window.
member.returns: The raw element provider for the specified window.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.RaiseAutomationEvent(System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent,System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple,System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises a pattern event or a custom event.
member.param: The event identifier.
The element associated with the event.
Information about the event.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.RaiseAutomationPropertyChangedEvent(System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple,System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises an event when a UI Automation property has changed.
member.param: The element associated with the event.
Information about the event.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.RaiseStructureChangedEvent(System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple,System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises an event when the UI Automation tree has changed.
member.param: The element associated with the event.
Information about the event.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.ReturnRawElementProvider(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple)
member.summary: Returns the UI automation provider for an element in response to a message.
member.param: Handle of the element's window.
The member of the message.
The member of the message.
The UI Automation provider for the element.
member.returns: A pointer to data that should be assigned to before passing the message to the base window procedure.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.ClientsAreListening
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether any UI Automation client application is subscribed to UI Automation events.
member.returns: if a client is subscribed to events; otherwise .

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IDockProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that expose their dock properties within a docking container.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IDockProvider.SetDockPosition(System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition)
member.summary: Docks the control within a docking container.
member.param: The dock position, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IDockProvider.DockPosition
member.summary: Gets the current of the control within a docking container.
member.returns: The of the control, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IExpandCollapseProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that visually expand to display content and collapse to hide content.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IExpandCollapseProvider.Collapse
member.summary: Hides all nodes, controls, or content that are descendants of the control.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IExpandCollapseProvider.Expand
member.summary: Displays all child nodes, controls, or content of the control.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IExpandCollapseProvider.ExpandCollapseState
member.summary: Gets the state, expanded or collapsed, of the control.
member.returns: The state, expanded or collapsed, of the control.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to individual child controls of containers that implement .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridItemProvider.Column
member.summary: Gets the ordinal number of the column that contains the cell or item.
member.returns: A zero-based ordinal number that identifies the column containing the cell or item.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridItemProvider.ColumnSpan
member.summary: Gets the number of columns spanned by a cell or item.
member.returns: The number of columns spanned.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridItemProvider.ContainingGrid
member.summary: Gets a UI Automation provider that implements and represents the container of the cell or item.
member.returns: A UI Automation provider that implements the and represents the cell or item container.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridItemProvider.Row
member.summary: Gets the ordinal number of the row that contains the cell or item.
member.returns: A zero-based ordinal number that identifies the row containing the cell or item.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridItemProvider.RowSpan
member.summary: Gets the number of rows spanned by a cell or item.
member.returns: The number of rows spanned.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that act as containers for a collection of child elements. The children of this element must implement and be organized in a two-dimensional logical coordinate system that can be traversed (that is, a UI Automation client can move to adjacent controls) by using the keyboard.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridProvider.GetItem(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the UI Automation provider for the specified cell.
member.param: The ordinal number of the row of interest.
The ordinal number of the column of interest.
member.returns: The UI Automation provider for the specified cell.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridProvider.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of columns in a grid.
member.returns: The total number of columns in a grid.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IGridProvider.RowCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of rows in a grid.
member.returns: The total number of rows in a grid.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IInvokeProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that initiate or perform a single, unambiguous action and do not maintain state when activated.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IInvokeProvider.Invoke
member.summary: Sends a request to activate a control and initiate its single, unambiguous action.
member.exception: If the control is not enabled.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IItemContainerProvider
member.summary: Exposes a method to enable applications to find an element in a container, such as a virtualized list.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IItemContainerProvider.FindItemByProperty(System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves an element by the specified property value.
member.param: The item in the container after which to begin the search.
The property that contains the value to retrieve.
The value to retrieve.
member.returns: The first item that matches the search criterion; otherwise, if no items match.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that provide, and are able to switch between, multiple representations of the same set of information or child controls.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider.GetSupportedViews
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of control-specific view identifiers.
member.returns: A collection of values that identifies the views available for a UI Automation element.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider.GetViewName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the name of a control-specific view.
member.param: The view identifier.
member.exception: is not a member of the supported views collection.
member.returns: A localized name for the view.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider.SetCurrentView(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current control-specific view.
member.param: A view identifier.
member.exception: is not a member of the supported views collection.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider.CurrentView
member.summary: Gets the current control-specific view.
member.returns: The value for the current view of the UI Automation element.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that can be set to a value within a range.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.SetValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the value of the control.
member.param: The value to set.
member.exception: When is less than the minimum or greater than the maximum value of the control.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the value of a control is read-only.
member.returns: if the value is read-only; if it can be modified.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.LargeChange
member.summary: Gets the value that is added to or subtracted from the property when a large change is made, such as with the PAGE DOWN key.
member.returns: The large-change value supported by the control or null ( in Visual Basic) if the control does not support .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.Maximum
member.summary: Gets the maximum range value supported by the control.
member.returns: The maximum value supported by the control or null ( in Visual Basic) if the control does not support .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.Minimum
member.summary: Gets the minimum range value supported by the control.
member.returns: The minimum value supported by the control or null ( in Visual Basic) if the control does not support .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.SmallChange
member.summary: Gets the value that is added to or subtracted from the property when a small change is made, such as with an arrow key.
member.returns: The small-change value or null ( in Visual Basic) if the control does not support .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the control.
member.returns: The value of the control or null ( in Visual Basic) if the control does not support .

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderAdviseEvents
member.summary: Exposes methods that are called to notify the root element of a fragment when a UI Automation client application begins or ends listening for events.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderAdviseEvents.AdviseEventAdded(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Notifies the UI Automation provider when a UI Automation client begins listening for a specific event, including a property-changed event.
member.param: The identifier of the event being added.
The identifiers of the properties being added, or if the event listener being added is not listening for property events.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderAdviseEvents.AdviseEventRemoved(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Notifies the UI Automation provider when a UI Automation client stops listening for a specific event, including a property-changed event.
member.param: The identifier of the event being removed.
The identifiers of the properties being removed, or if the event listener being removed is not listening for property events.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties on user interface (UI) elements that are part of a structure more than one level deep, such as a list box or a list item. Implemented by UI Automation providers.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.GetEmbeddedFragmentRoots
member.summary: Retrieves an array of fragment roots that are embedded in the UI Automation element tree rooted at the current element.
member.returns: An array of root fragments, or .

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.GetRuntimeId
member.summary: Retrieves the runtime identifier of an element.
member.returns: The unique run-time identifier of the element.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.Navigate(System.Windows.Automation.Provider.NavigateDirection)
member.summary: Retrieves the UI Automation element in a specified direction within the tree.
member.param: The direction in which to navigate.
member.returns: The element in the specified direction, or if there is no element in that direction.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.SetFocus
member.summary: Sets the focus to this element.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.BoundingRectangle
member.summary: Gets the bounding rectangle of this element.
member.returns: The bounding rectangle, in screen coordinates.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.FragmentRoot
member.summary: Retrieves the root node of the fragment.
member.returns: The root node.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragmentRoot
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties on the root element in a fragment.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragmentRoot.ElementProviderFromPoint(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Retrieves the element in this fragment that is at the specified point.
member.param: The X coordinate.
The Y coordinate.
member.returns: The provider for the child element at the specified point, if one exists, or the root provider if the point is on this element but not on any child element. Otherwise returns .

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragmentRoot.GetFocus
member.summary: Retrieves the element in this fragment that has the input focus.
member.returns: The provider for the element in this fragment that has the input focus, if any; otherwise, a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderHwndOverride
member.summary: Exposes a method that enables repositioning of window-based elements within the UI Automation tree of the fragment.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderHwndOverride.GetOverrideProviderForHwnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves a UI automation provider for the specified element.
member.param: The window handle of the element.
member.returns: The provider for the specified element, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if the element's default provider is not being overridden.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to individual child controls of containers that implement .

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollItemProvider.ScrollIntoView
member.summary: Scrolls the content area of a container object in order to display the control within the visible region (viewport) of the container.
member.exception: The item cannot be scrolled into view.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to a control that acts as a scrollable container for a collection of child objects. The children of this control must implement .

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.Scroll(System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount,System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount)
member.summary: Scrolls the visible region of the content area horizontally and vertically.
member.param: The horizontal increment specific to the control. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical increment specific to the control. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
member.exception: If a control supports values exclusively for horizontal or vertical scrolling but a value is passed in.
An attempt is made to scroll in an unsupported direction.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.SetScrollPercent(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the horizontal and vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
member.param: The horizontal position as a percentage of the content area's total range. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical position as a percentage of the content area's total range. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
member.exception: A value that cannot be converted to a double is passed in.
A value greater than 100 or less than 0 is passed in (except -1, which is equivalent to ). The and values are normalized to either 100 percent or 0 percent.
An attempt is made to scroll in an unsupported direction.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontallyScrollable
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll horizontally.
member.returns: if the control can scroll horizontally; otherwise .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontalScrollPercent
member.summary: Gets the current horizontal scroll position.
member.returns: The horizontal scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontalViewSize
member.summary: Gets the current horizontal view size.
member.returns: The horizontal size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticallyScrollable
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll vertically.
member.returns: if the control can scroll vertically; otherwise .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticalScrollPercent
member.summary: Gets the current vertical scroll position.
member.returns: The vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticalViewSize
member.summary: Gets the vertical view size.
member.returns: The vertical size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to individual, selectable child controls of containers that implement .

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.AddToSelection
member.summary: Adds the current element to the collection of selected items.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.RemoveFromSelection
member.summary: Removes the current element from the collection of selected items.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.Select
member.summary: Deselects any selected items and then selects the current element.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an item is selected.
member.returns: if the element is selected; otherwise .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.SelectionContainer
member.summary: Gets the UI Automation provider that implements and acts as the container for the calling object.
member.returns: The provider that supports .

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that act as containers for a collection of individual, selectable child items. The children of this control must implement .

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.GetSelection
member.summary: Retrieves a UI Automation provider for each child element that is selected.
member.returns: A collection of UI Automation providers.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.CanSelectMultiple
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the UI Automation provider allows more than one child element to be selected concurrently.
member.returns: if multiple selection is allowed; otherwise .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.IsSelectionRequired
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the UI Automation provider requires at least one child element to be selected.
member.returns: if selection is required; otherwise .

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods to facilitate UI Automation client access to controls that support synchronized input.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider.Cancel
member.summary: Stops listening for input.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider.StartListening(System.Windows.Automation.SynchronizedInputType)
member.summary: Designates that the provider start listening for input of the specified type.
member.param: The type of input to listen for.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to child controls of containers that implement .

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableItemProvider.GetColumnHeaderItems
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of UI Automation providers representing all the column headers associated with a table item or cell.
member.returns: A collection of UI Automation providers.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableItemProvider.GetRowHeaderItems
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of UI Automation providers representing all the row headers associated with a table item or cell.
member.returns: A collection of UI Automation providers.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that act as containers for a collection of child elements. The children of this element must implement and be organized in a two-dimensional logical coordinate system that can be traversed (that is, a UI Automation client can move to adjacent controls) by using the keyboard.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider.GetColumnHeaders
member.summary: Gets a collection of UI Automation providers that represents all the column headers in a table.
member.returns: A collection of UI Automation providers.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider.GetRowHeaders
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of UI Automation providers that represents all row headers in the table.
member.returns: A collection of UI Automation providers.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider.RowOrColumnMajor
member.summary: Retrieves the primary direction of traversal for the table.
member.returns: The primary direction of traversal.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that contain text.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider.GetSelection
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of disjoint text ranges associated with the current text selection or selections.
member.exception: If the UI Automation provider does not support text selection.
member.returns: A collection of disjoint text ranges.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider.GetVisibleRanges
member.summary: Retrieves an array of disjoint text ranges from a text container where each text range begins with the first partially visible line through to the end of the last partially visible line.
member.returns: The collection of visible text ranges within the container or an empty array. A null reference ( in Visual Basic) is never returned.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider.RangeFromChild(System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple)
member.summary: Retrieves a text range enclosing a child element such as an image, hyperlink, or other embedded object.
member.param: The enclosed object.
member.exception: If the child element is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
member.returns: A range that spans the child element.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider.RangeFromPoint(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Returns the degenerate (empty) text range nearest to the specified screen coordinates.
member.param: The location in screen coordinates.
member.exception: If a given point is outside the UI Automation element associated with the text pattern.
member.returns: A degenerate range nearest the specified location. A null reference ( in Visual Basic) is never returned.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider.DocumentRange
member.summary: Gets a text range that encloses the main text of a document.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider.SupportedTextSelection
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether a text provider supports selection and, if so, the type of selection supported.
member.returns: One of the values.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IToggleProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that can cycle through a set of states and maintain a state once set.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IToggleProvider.Toggle
member.summary: Cycles through the toggle states of a control.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IToggleProvider.ToggleState
member.summary: Gets the toggle state of the control.
member.returns: The of the control.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that can be moved, resized, or rotated within a two-dimensional space.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.Move(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Moves the control.
member.param: Absolute screen coordinates of the left side of the control.
Absolute screen coordinates of the top of the control.
member.exception: If the property is false.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.Resize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Resizes the control.
member.param: The new width of the window, in pixels.
The new height of the window, in pixels.
member.exception: If the property is false.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.Rotate(System.Double)
member.summary: Rotates the control.
member.param: The number of degrees to rotate the control. A positive number rotates clockwise; a negative number rotates counterclockwise.
member.exception: If the property is false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanMove
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the control can be moved.
member.returns: if the element can be moved; otherwise .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanResize
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the UI Automation element can be resized.
member.returns: if the element can be resized; otherwise .

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanRotate
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the control can be rotated.
member.returns: if the element can be rotated; otherwise .

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls having an intrinsic value that does not span a range and that can be represented as a string.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider.SetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of a control.
member.param: The value to set. The provider is responsible for converting the value to the appropriate data type.
member.exception: If locale-specific information is passed to a control in an incorrect format such as an incorrectly formatted date.
If a new value cannot be converted from a string to a format the control recognizes.
When an attempt is made to manipulate a control that is not enabled.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the value of a control is read-only.
member.returns: if the value is read-only; if it can be modified.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the control.
member.returns: The value of the control as a string.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes a method to support the virtualized item control pattern.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider.Realize
member.summary: Makes the virtual item fully accessible as a UI Automation element.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that provide fundamental window-based functionality within a traditional graphical user interface (GUI).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider.Close
member.summary: Attempts to close the window.
member.exception: When the control is unable to perform the requested action.
When the target element is no longer available (for example, the window has closed).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider.SetVisualState(System.Windows.Automation.WindowVisualState)
member.summary: Changes the visual state of the window. For example, minimizes or maximizes it.
member.param: The requested visual state of the window.
member.exception: When the control does not support the requested behavior.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IWindowProvider.WaitForInputIdle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Causes the calling code to block for the specified time or until the associated process enters an idle state, whichever completes first.
member.param: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait for the associated process to become idle. The maximum is .
member.exception: When the parameter passed in is not a valid number.
member.returns: if the window has entered the idle state; if the timeout occurred.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.NavigateDirection

member.summary: The navigation direction is to the first child.
